intro: Macnabia, commonly known as the yellow bellflower, is a flowering plant native to parts of North America. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family, which includes many bell-shaped flowers. The plant features showy, yellowish-orange blooms that resemble small bells, typically appearing in late summer. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often have a hairy texture. Macnabia thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland or wetland habitats.
